opts.opt: Cortical platform Striking platform is ‘cortex’ at point of force application. Cortex here refers to the original inner and outer surface of the bottle (after Gorman, 2000, p. 261).
Single facet platform Point of force application (PFA) is located on a flake scar or broken face.
Dihedral PFA is located on the ridge between two scars.
Multifaceted platform PFA is located on a surface with multiple scars.
Edge platform Flake initiated at the very edge of the platform. A discrete platform surface is not identifiable on the flake, but a clear PFA is present.
Collapsed/crushed platform The platform shattered during impact. Platform dimensions cannot be recorded.
